## Lesson 8: Visual Predictive Check (VPC)

---

<center>
<a class = "registration-button" href="https://certara.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_fLBYsjRsTxaiCjZnIwycNg#/registration" target="_blank">Register for Lesson 8 Webinar</a>

<a href = "https://certara.github.io/R-RsNLME/index.html"><img src='img/tidyvpc.png'  align="left" style = "height: 150px; padding-right: 10px;"/></a>

In Lesson 8, we will demonstrate usage of [`RsNLME`](https://certara.github.io/R-RsNLME/) with the [`tidyvpc`](https://certara.github.io/tidyvpc/) package to perform a Visual Predictive Check (VPC).

<br></br>
<br></br>
<br></br>


### Live Webinar Date: 11/30/2022 @10am EST

In the webinar we will cover the following topics:

* Executing a VPC run in [`RsNLME`](https://certara.github.io/R-RsNLME/)
* Explore different binning and binless methods to compute VPC statistics in [`tidyvpc`](https://certara.github.io/tidyvpc/)
* Use the [`VPCResults`](https://certara.github.io/R-VPCResults/) Shiny App to parameterize a VPC from the GUI and generate corresponding R code for reproducibility in RStudio
* Customize the resulting VPC plot using [`ggplot2`](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/)
